title: Celebrations in Gaza as Palestine qualifies for Arab Cup quarter-finals
summary: Video shows crowds in Gaza celebrating after Palestine qualified for the Arab Cup quarter-finals.

title: How many Syrians have returned home one year since the fall of al-Assad?
summary: One year after al-Assad’s fall, nearly 1.8 million displaced Syrians and 780,000 refugees have returned home.

title: UN faces ‘brutal choices’ as it launches 2026 aid appeal
summary: Aid cuts mean UN is asking for just half of anticipated need and is forced to prioritise only the most desperate.

title: Humza Yousaf says Israel deliberately destroyed Gaza’s education system
summary: Former Scottish First Minister Humza Yousaf said that Israel is carrying out what he calls a “scholasticide” in Gaza.

title: Searching for Amani: A boy investigates his father’s death in Kenya
summary: A 13-year-old aspiring journalist investigates his father’s death in one of Kenya’s largest wildlife conservation parks.

title: Are Israel, Hamas entering the second phase of the ceasefire?
summary: Israel has kept attacking Gaza during the first phase, so what will the second phase bring?

title: LIVE: Syria marks one year since fall of Bashar al-Assad
summary: Syrians marking one year since the fall of longtime ruler Bashar al-Assad after nearly 14 years of war.

title: WFP says six million starving in Sudan
summary: Carl Skau, deputy executive director at the World Food Programme, talks limitations concerns in Sudan

title: ‘Stop killing us’: Huge crowds rally in Brazil, decrying rise in femicide
summary: Demonstrators march in Rio de Janeiro, Sao Paulo and other cities, calling for an end to femicide, rape and misogyny.

title: Nigeria secures release of 100 kidnapped children, reports say
summary: At least 153 students and 12 teachers taken from a Catholic school last month remain in captivity.

title: US lawmakers urge release of video of double-tap boat strike in Caribbean
summary: At least 87 people have been killed in Trump administration's strikes on alleged drug-smuggling vessels.

title: Nigeria says it deployed jets, troops to Benin to ‘dislodge coup plotters’
summary: Nigeria's president says he sent fighter jets, troops to Benin to help quell a coup attempt by mutinous soldiers.

title: Quel bilan pour Ahmed al-Charaa, un an après la chute d’Assad en Syrie ?
summary: Un an après la chute de Bachar al-Assad, la Syrie tente de se reconstruire sur les ruines d’un conflit qui a duré plus de 13 ans. Une transition fragile sous la direction d’Ahmed al-Charaa, ex-chef rebelle devenu président intérimaire. Économie exsangue, institutions embryonnaires, pays morcelé... les défis sont énormes.

title: Le chancelier allemand Friedrich Merz réaffirme le soutien de son pays à Israël
summary: Le chancelier allemand, Friedrich Merz, a réaffirmé le soutien de l'Allemagne à Israël dimanche, lors d'une visite au mémorial de la Shoah, Yad Vashem, à Jérusalem, avant d'entamer une rencontre avec son homologue, Benjamin Netanyahu.

title: Benjamin Netanyahu veut enclencher "très bientôt" la deuxième phase de l'accord à Gaza
summary: Benjamin Netanyahu a annoncé dimanche une transition "très bientôt" vers la deuxième phase du cessez-le-feu à Gaza. Le Hamas doit toutefois restituer à Israël un dernier corps d'otage, conformément à la phase un de l'accord, a rappelé le Premier ministre israélien. De son côté, le chef de l'armée israélienne a affirmé en fin de journée que la ligne de démarcation dans Gaza est la "nouvelle frontière".

title: Un an après la chute d'Assad, des syriens reviennent après 11 ans d'exil
summary: Les Syriens marquent le premier anniversaire de l'offensive éclair des forces conduites par les islamistes qui ont renversé Assad le 8 décembre 2024, après près de 14 ans de guerre.

title: Syrie : vers un retour des touristes dans la ville antique de Palmyre ?
summary: Longtemps considérée comme l’un des joyaux archéologiques du Moyen-Orient, Palmyre a subi de lourdes destructions au cours du conflit syrien. Aujourd’hui, alors que certaines zones connaissent un relatif apaisement, la question d’un possible retour des touristes se pose. Les autorités locales affichent leur volonté de restaurer les monuments les plus emblématiques et de relancer l’activité culturelle.

title: À Jérusalem, Friedrich Merz assure Israël du soutien "immuable" de l'Allemagne
summary: En visite pour la première fois dans l'État hébreu depuis sa prise de fonction, le chancelier allemand a assuré Israël samedi du soutien "immuable" de l'Allemagne. Friedrich Merz doit rencontrer dimanche le Premier ministre Benjamin Netanyahu, de plus en plus isolé sur le plan international, pour discuter avec lui des efforts en vue de passer à une deuxième phase du cessez-le-feu à Gaza.

title: Dans la Syrie post-Assad, quel avenir pour la justice transitionnelle ?
summary: Pendant plus de cinquante ans, la famille Assad s'est maintenue au pouvoir en perpétrant des crimes de masse. Depuis la chute du régime, le 8 décembre 2024, deux commissions dédiées à la justice transitionnelle ont été mises en place par les nouvelles autorités. Un processus qui s'annonce long et complexe. Entretien.

title: Gaza : le Hamas prêt à remettre ses armes à une autorité palestinienne, "si l'occupation cesse"
summary: Le chef du Hamas pour Gaza se dit prêt à remettre ses armes à une future autorité palestinienne à Gaza si l'occupation israélienne cesse. Khalil al-Hayya déclare accepter une force de l’ONU pour superviser un cessez-le-feu, mais refuse toute mission visant à le désarmer.

title: Selon Al-Charaa, la volonté d’Israël de démilitariser le sud de la Syrie met la région en danger
summary: Le président syrien par intérim Ahmed al-Charaa a mis en garde contre la demande israélienne d'établir une zone démilitarisée au sud de la Syrie. Il estime qu'elle remettrait en cause l'accord de désengagement de 1974 et placerait Damas dans une position "grave et dangereuse".

title: Syrie : premier anniversaire de la chute de l'ex président Bachar al-Assad
summary: Une délégation du Conseil de sécurité de l'ONU est arrivée jeudi en Syrie, pour une toute première visite dans ce pays, à quelques jours du premier anniversaire de la chute de l'ex président Bachar al-Assad, a rapporté l'agence Sana.

title: Le cessez-le-feu à Gaza reste incomplet sans "un retrait total" d'Israël, estime le Qatar
summary: En vigueur depuis près de deux mois, le cessez-le-feu dans la bande de Gaza ne pourra être considéré comme complet qu'après le retrait total des forces israéliennes, a déclaré samedi le Premier ministre du Qatar, médiateur dans le conflit qui oppose le territoire palestinien occupé et l'État hébreu.

title: Le Liban exhorte l'ONU à faire pression sur Israël pour le respect du cessez-le-feu
summary: Le président libanais Joseph Aoun a appelé vendredi une délégation du Conseil de sécurité des Nations unies à faire pression sur Israël pour que le pays respecte le cessez-le-feu signé avec le Hezbollah il y a un an. Des responsables civils libanais et israéliens ont participé mercredi pour la première fois à un comité de surveillance du cessez-le-feu.

title: L’ONU fustige l’« apathie » du monde en lançant son appel humanitaire 2026
summary: L’ONU réclame 33 millions de dollars pour soutenir 135 millions de personnes à Gaza, au Soudan, en Haïti, en Birmanie, en RDC, ou encore en Ukraine, dans un contexte de coupe drastique de l’aide extérieure américaine décidée par Donald Trump.

title: Dopage et corruption dans l’athlétisme : le nouveau procès en appel du fils de Lamine Diack, l’ex-patron de l’IAAF, s’ouvre à Paris
summary: En 2020, Papa Massata Diack avait été condamné à cinq ans d’emprisonnement pour complicité au sein d’un système de pots-de-vin visant à cacher des cas de dopage sanguins chez des sportifs russes en 2011, un an avant les Jeux olympiques de Londres.

title: EN DIRECT, guerre en Ukraine : Volodymyr Zelensky reçu à Londres lundi ; Emmanuel Macron et Friedrich Merz seront également présents
summary: Cette nouvelle réunion doit permettre de faire le point sur « les négociations en cours dans le cadre de la médiation américaine », avait annoncé samedi Emmanuel Macron, en promettant de « continuer à faire pression sur la Russie pour la contraindre à la paix ».

title: « Après moi, c’est fini, tout est terminé » : en Amazonie brésilienne, rencontre avec Rita, ultime mémoire du « peuple papillon »
summary: Cette femme d’une soixantaine d’années, que nos reporters ont rencontrée au cœur de la « grande forêt » brésilienne, est l’ultime représentante des Piripkura, un groupe amérindien sur le point de disparaître, comme d’autres peuplades indigènes de la région.

title: Les Européens sidérés autant que mis au défi par la nouvelle stratégie de sécurité des Etats-Unis
summary: Dans le document publié vendredi, l’administration Trump se livre à un acte d’ingérence inédit dans la politique intérieure de ses alliés du Vieux Continent. Mais au sein de l’UE comme à Londres, où se retrouvent, lundi, les dirigeants français, britannique et allemand, les réactions se veulent mesurées pour ne pas creuser davantage un fossé de plus en plus béant.

title: En Syrie, la mue inachevée d’Ahmed Al-Charaa, rebelle islamiste devenu président
summary: « Syrie, l’après Assad » (1/5). Le tombeur du régime baasiste a réussi à rompre l’isolement international de son pays. Mais en interne, ce djihadiste repenti, qui gouverne avec une poignée de fidèles, peine à désamorcer les tensions confessionnelles et ethniques héritées de la guerre civile.

title: Syrie : quel bilan, un an après la chute de la dictature ?
summary: Le 8 décembre 2024, Bachar Al-Assad quittait Damas, mettant un terme à plus d’un demi-siècle de dictature exercée par sa famille en Syrie. Une chute orchestrée par un homme : Ahmed Al-Charaa devenu, depuis, le président par intérim du pays. Retour en podcast sur cette première année de la République syrienne.

title: Les affrontements à la frontière entre la Thaïlande et le Cambodge reprennent, un soldat thaïlandais tué et quatre autres blessés
summary: Chaque camp accuse l’autre d’avoir déclenché les hostilités. L’armée thaïlandaise a dit utiliser des avions pour « frapper des cibles militaires » et « mettre fin aux tirs de soutien cambodgiens ».

title: Donald Trump exprime des doutes sur le rachat de Warner par Netflix et prévoit de « s’impliquer » dans le dossier
summary: Le président américain estime que cette acquisition « pourrait être un problème » alors que le géant du streaming a déjà « une très grosse part de marché ».

title: A Madrid, la fin annoncée du Café Central, symbole d’une ville en pleine mutation
summary: Le haut lieu du jazz madrilène doit fermer ses portes début 2026. L’annonce a suscité un fort émoi alors que la capitale espagnole subit un phénomène de gentrification accéléré.

title: Pérou : un journaliste assassiné par des hommes armés, une hausse des homicides dans le pays
summary: Fernando Nuñez est le troisième reporter abattu au Pérou depuis le début de l’année. L’Association nationale des journalistes a exigé que les autorités privilégient la piste de son travail comme mobile du crime.

title: Au Brésil, huit gravures d’Henri Matisse volées dans une bibliothèque de Sao Paulo
summary: Ces œuvres, ainsi que cinq autres du peintre brésilien Candido Portinari, faisaient l’objet d’une exposition organisée en collaboration entre la bibliothèque Mario de Andrade et le Musée d’art moderne de Sao Paulo.

title: Israel earmarks almost $1 billion to expand illegal West Bank settlements
summary:
Israel earmarks almost $1 billion to expand illegal West Bank settlements

Far-right Israeli Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich has set aside approximately more than $830 million to fund the creation of 17 new settlements in the occupied West Bank over the next five years, according to the Israeli newspaper Yediot Aharonot.

The move signals an accelerated push to entrench illegal Jewish-only settlements on Palestinian land, further tightening Israel’s grip on the territory and deepening its system of apartheid and colonisation.

title: Israeli forces wound Palestinian, deploy bulldozers near Jerusalem
summary:
Israeli forces wound Palestinian, deploy bulldozers near Jerusalem

A young Palestinian man sustained injuries after Israeli forces opened live fire near the apartheid wall in the town of al-Ram, north of occupied Jerusalem. The Palestine Red Crescent said its teams responded at the scene and provided medical assistance to the wounded man.

In a separate escalation, Israeli occupation forces stormed the nearby town of Hizma, also north of Jerusalem, accompanied by military bulldozers.

According to Al Jazeera’s correspondent, the raid appears to be linked to preparations for house demolitions in the area, as Israeli troops tightened their control and secured the surroundings.

title: Social media users rally around Ms Rachel after spike in threats
summary:
Social media users rally around Ms Rachel after spike in threats

The popular American children's content creator, Ms Rachel, has said that since being shortlisted by a pro-Israel group for "Antisemite of the Year", there has been a spike in threats towards her and her family. 

In a statement posted on Instagram on Thursday, Ms Rachel, also known as Rachel Griffin Accurso, revealed that constant attacks by the pro-Israel group StopAntisemitism had forced her to hire security amid false claims that she supported the Palestinian group Hamas.

"The Stop Antisemitism Now group should not be able to try to ruin people's lives, cause them to receive threats and need security, try to get all business partners to drop them, accuse them of a serious crime (being paid by HAMAS) and get news to cover it with no evidence," she said in a statement, before adding that the constant attacks had impacted her two young children.

"Remembering my son accidentally overhearing us talking about my safety and then him crying wanting to hold my hand all night scared something would happen to me," she said.

"This has taken such a toll on me and my family and all I've wanted was to help kids."

Read more: Social media users rally around Ms Rachel after spike in threats

title: Israeli army reports surge in troops suffering trauma after Gaza genocide
summary:
Israeli army reports surge in troops suffering trauma after Gaza genocide

The Israeli army said around 22,000 officers and soldiers have been wounded since the start of Israel's war on Gaza in 2023, with more than half now suffering from post-traumatic stress disorder.

The figures highlight the severe psychological and physical toll of Israel’s ongoing genocidal war on Gaza on its own forces.

title: Morning recap
summary:
Morning recap

Good morning Middle East Eye readers,

Here are the latest updates from Israel's war on Palestinians in Gaza and the West Bank:

  • Israeli occupation forces opened heavy fire near the Morag axis, north of Rafah in the southern Gaza Strip, according to Palestinian sources on the ground.

  • As Israel and Hamas edge towards a possible second phase of a United States-backed proposal to end Israel’s genocidal war on Gaza, disputes centre on the undefined role of a potential international “stabilisation force” inside the besieged enclave.

  • Senior Hamas official Basem Naim said on Sunday that the US proposal required “a lot of clarifications”. He added that while Hamas could consider “freezing or storing” its weapons during the current truce, it would not accept an external force taking control of disarmament.

  • In the occupied West Bank, Israeli occupation forces carried out a fresh wave of raids and arrests after storming the town of Allar, north of Tulkarm, according to local sources.

  • Israeli forces also pushed into the city of Nablus from the Huwara checkpoint, escalating military pressure in the northern West Bank.

  • The Israeli army sent additional military reinforcements towards Balata refugee camp, east of Nablus, while soldiers deployed in the al-Hashashin neighbourhood, residents reported.

title: Evening recap
summary:
Evening recap

Our live blog will shortly be closing until tomorrow morning.

Here are the day's key developments:

  • Israeli military says its forces shot dead a Palestinian in the occupied West Bank.

  • Unrwa said it has found children in Gaza suffering from acute malnutrition during routine screening.

  • Palestinians in the occupied West Bank city of Hebron launched a general strike to protest the killing of two Palestinians by Israeli forces a day earlier.

  • Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said that Israel is close to completing the first phase of US President Donald Trump’s Gaza plan.

  • The Palestinian health ministry in Gaza said Israeli forces have killed at least 373 people and wounded 970 others since the start of the ceasefire in October. 

  • The International Committee of the Red Cross said it had facilitated the transfer of five Palestinian detainees to Gaza.

  • Israeli prime minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Israel will remain in the territories it seized in Syria, Haaretz reported.

  • Israeli soldiers shot at three Palestinians in the occupied West Bank and killed one of them, the Israeli military said.

title: Two children wounded by Israeli forced in occupied West Bank
summary:
Two children wounded by Israeli forced in occupied West Bank

The Palestine Red Crescent Society transported two children, aged 17 and 12, to the hospital with wounds following an attack by Israeli soldiers in the occupied Bank, Wafa news agency reported.

The two were attacked at the Beit Furik military checkpoint, which is east of the city of Nablus.

title: Trump's UN envoy says 'ready to move forward' with rebuilding Gaza
summary:
Trump's UN envoy says 'ready to move forward' with rebuilding Gaza

Mike Waltz, the US ambassador to the United Nations, toured a storage centre in Jordan with humanitarian aid supplies set for delivery to the Gaza Strip.

In a video posted on X, Waltz said Jordanian and UN partners are doing “vital work” to deliver humanitarian aid to Gaza, particularly as winter approaches.

"We're ready to move forward with rebuilding Gaza, the provision of security and providing not only the life-saving humanitarian goods, but eventually getting to the rebuilding that we absolutely need," he said.

Visited the Jordan Hashemite Charity Organization (JHCO) warehouse to see the vital work Jordanian and UN partners are doing to deliver humanitarian aid to Gaza, particularly as winter approaches.

The U.S. is proud to support Jordan’s efforts to address urgent needs and save… pic.twitter.com/pHkcmNBFjO

— Ambassador Mike Waltz (@USAmbUN) December 7, 2025

title: Israeli fire injures Palestinian child in West Bank
summary:
Israeli fire injures Palestinian child in West Bank

A Palestinian child was injured on Sunday evening by live bullet shrapnel fired by Israeli forces in the town of Burqin, west of Jenin, Wafa news agency reported.

According to local sources, Israeli forces entered the town and opened fire on residents, injuring a 12-year-old boy in the knee with bullet shrapnel while he was riding his bicycle.

title: Israeli military says its forces shot dead Palestinian in occupied West Bank
summary:
Israeli military says its forces shot dead Palestinian in occupied West Bank

Israeli soldiers shot at three Palestinians in the occupied West Bank on Sunday and killed one of them, the Israeli military said. 

The army claimed they were throwing stones toward a main road near Azzun.

The Palestinian Red Crescent said one person had been killed and one wounded in the incident.

The Israeli military said that apart from the fatality, one other person was killed and one arrested.

title: Unifil slams Israeli ceasefire violations in Lebanon
summary:
Unifil slams Israeli ceasefire violations in Lebanon

United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon (Unifil), called Israeli attacks on Lebanon a “constant and blatant violation of Resolution 1701”.

Major General Diodato Abagnara, the commander of the Unifil told Israeli media that, “the situation is really, really fragile” in Lebanon, and “a simple mistake could create a big escalation”.

“Any kind of direct attack against Unifil troops is unacceptable,” he said, apparently referring to past Israeli strikes on the peacekeepers.

The UN organisation said Israel violated the ceasefire deal with thousands of air and ground attacks inside Lebanon.

title: Netanyahu says Israel will keep Syrian territories it seized
summary:
Netanyahu says Israel will keep Syrian territories it seized

Israeli prime minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Israel will remain in the territories it seized in Syria, Haaretz reported.

"We very much hope that we will be able to reach a demilitarisation agreement for southern Syria and also take care of our Druze brothers," Netanyahu said at a meeting with Israeli ambassadors.

"But we want to keep these assets," he added.

His comments came after Syrian President Ahmed al-Sharaa reiterated his call for Israel to withdraw from territories seized by Israel since December last year, and said negotiations were underway with the United States for an Israeli withdrawal.

Israeli forces crossed into southern Syria following the fall of the Bashar al-Assad government on 8 December 2024, and continue to occupy a United Nations buffer zone - the strategic heights of Mount Hermon - which overlooks Israel, Lebanon and Syria.

title: Five Iranians nominated for Best Wrestler of 2025
summary: Tehran, IRNA – The United World Wrestling announced that five Iranians have been nominated for the Best Wrestler of 2025.

title: Iran foreign minister meets Azerbaijan president in Baku
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi met with Azerbaijani President Ilham Aliyev in Baku, where the two sides discussed a wide range of bilateral, regional, and international issues of mutual interest.

title: Iran Border Guard Commander arrives in Pakistan
summary: Islamabad, IRNA – Commander of Iran's Border Guards, Brigadier-General Ahmad Ali Goudarzi, has arrived in the Pakistani port city of Karachi to participate in international search and rescue exercises.

title: Foreign minister says Iran is determined to continue its peaceful nuclear program
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi says Iran’s nuclear sites were “destroyed and heavily damaged” during the 12-day US-Israeli war of aggression in June, yet the Islamic Republic remains determined to continue its peaceful nuclear program.

title: Children and Youth Theater Festival opens in Hamedan
summary: The 30th International Children and Youth Theater Festival kicked off in Iran’s Hamedan on Sunday, December 6, 2025, showcasing six performances on its opening day. Running through Thursday, the event features domestic and foreign theater troupes across six venues in the city, seven halls in nearby towns, and two mobile stages.

title: Off-Road competition at third national championship in Iran
summary: The third edition of the National Off-Road Racing Championship for men and women was held across six different classes in Iran on December 6, 2025, where top drivers faced demanding courses as they battled for the top titles.

title: Defense Minister: Reality of Iran’s progress is different from the Westerners’ depiction
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Defense Minister Brigadier Aziz Nasirzadeh addressing the students of Malek Ashtar University of Technology said that the reality of Iran’s progress is different from the depictions of Westerners.

title: Gharibabadi: Iran-Brazil relations have significant potential for expansion
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Deputy Foreign Minister for Legal and International Affairs Kazem Gharibabadi has stressed that Iran and Brazil have great potentials for expamding their relations.

title: Trump threatens Venezuela with ground military operations
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Tensions between Venezuela and the United States have escalated further as President Donald Trump says that ground operations against alleged drug trafficking networks in the South American nation will start ‘very soon.’

title: Foreign Minister Araghchi arrives in Baku
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi arrived in Baku, the capital of Azerbaijan, at the head of a political delegation to meet and consult with officials of the Republic of Azerbaijan.

title: Iran’s foreign policy centers on regional partnerships and relations: VP
summary: Tehran, IRNA – First Vice President Mohammad Reza Aref says that Iran’s diplomatic strategy focuses on expanding relations with neighboring and regional countries, emphasizing a “partnership” approach in this pursuit.

title: IRGC chief calls for upgrading missiles with stealth and AI technologies
summary: Tehran, IRNA – IRGC Chief Commander Major General Mohammad Pakpour has emphasized the need to enhance Iran’s missiles with stealth technology to strengthen their ability to penetrate enemy defenses.

title: Iranians half of nominees for 2025 world's best wrestlers
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 08 (MNA) – Iran emerged as the leading nation in United World Wrestling’s 2025 Best Wrestlers shortlist, securing five of the ten total nominations announced on Monday.

title: Iranian president scheduled to visit Kazakhstan
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 08 (MNA) – President of the Islamic Republic of Iran, Masoud Pezeshkian, will pay an official visit to Kazakhstan this week.

title: Araghchi, Aliyev stress expanding Tehran-Baku cooperation
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 08 (MNA) – Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi and Azerbaijan's President Ilham Aliyev stressed the need for expanding the Tehran-Baku bilateral relations and cooperation in various fields.

title: Qatar warns of risks of conflicts with Iran for region
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 08 (MNA) – Qatar’s Prime Minister and Foreign Minister, Mohammed bin Abdulrahman Al Thani, said any escalation of tensions with Iran could have significant consequences for the region.

title: US to spend $800 million on support for Ukraine
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 08 (MNA) – The US’ draft budget allocates $400 million each for support for Ukraine in 2026 and 2027.

title: 36 killed in Iran's attack on Mossad headquarters: IRGC Spox.
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 08 (MNA) – The Islamic Revolutionary Guards Corps (IRGC)’s spokesman says that 36 people were killed in Iran's missile strike on the Mossad headquarters during the 12-day war with Israel.

title: Iran's Araghchi holds meeting with Azeri president in Baku
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 08 (MNA) – Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi held a meeting with Ilham Aliyev, the President of Azerbaijan, in Baku on Monday morning.

title: Russian trade delegation visits Iran
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 08 (MNA) – A high-level commercial delegation from Russia’s Ulyanovsk province has arrived in Iran to explore trade and investment opportunities.

title: Inside Iran’s largest naval exercise in years
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 08 (MNA) – Iran’s IRGC staged one of its most massive military drills in years, integrating AI-guided air-defense systems, drones, and long-range missiles across the Persian Gulf, sending a stark warning to foreigners.

title: 5.8 magnitude earthquake shakes Alaska
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 08 (MNA) – An earthquake with a magnitude of 5.8 was registered in Alaska, the US Geological Survey (USGS) reported.

title: No decision made on blacklisting Hezbollah, Ansarallah
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 08 (MNA) – Iraqi Prime Minister Mohammed Shia’ al-Sudani rejected reports claiming that Hezbollah and Yemen’s Ansarallah had been designated as terrorist organizations in Iraq.

title: Israeli Navy holding joint drill with US Navy’s 5th Fleet
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 08 (MNA) – The Israeli military announced the start of a weeklong joint naval exercise with the US Fifth Fleet, headquartered in Bahrain.

title: تبریز زیر باران؛ هوای تازه بعد از روزهای آلوده
summary: تبریز- بارش باران پس از چند روز آلودگی، هوای تبریز را تازه کرد و چهره شهر را از غبار خاکستری بیرون آورد؛ بارانی که نفس شهروندان را سبک‌تر و خیابان‌ها را بانشاط‌تر کرد.

title: آغاز پویش «شهر؛ قدردان توست» با محور توانمندسازی بانوان قمی
summary: قم- رئیس کمیسیون بانوان شورای اسلامی شهر قم از آغاز پویش «شهر؛ قدردان توست» همزمان با هفته گرامیداشت مقام زن و مادر خبر داد.

title: پسر ترامپ، دولت زلنسکی را فاسد و جنگ طلب خواند
summary: پسر ارشد رئیس‌جمهوری آمریکا، دولت اوکراین را فاسد و جنگ‌طلب اعلام کرد و از احتمال توقف حمایت واشنگتن از کی‌یف خبرداد.

title: تکیه‌ای: بیش از ۶۰ کشور مراسم اعتکاف را برگزار می‌کنند
summary: قم- رئیس ستاد ملی اعتکاف با اشاره به توسعه آیین اعتکاف در بیش از ۶۰ کشور، نقش قم را در شکل‌دهی به این جریان معنوی و تربیتی برجسته دانست.

title: جشن ولادت حضرت زهرا(س) در آستان مسجد جمکران برگزار می شود
summary: قم- مراسم آستان مقدس مسجد جمکران در این هفته، با محوریت ولادت صدیقه طاهره، حضرت زهرا (س) برگزار خواهد شد.

title: ابراز همدردی رئیس هلال‌احمر با حادثه‌دیدگان سیل اندونزی
summary: رییس جمعیت هلال‌احمر با ارسال پیامی، ضمن ابراز همدردی با خانواده قربانیان حادثه سیلاب اندونزی، آمادگی این جمعیت را جهت اعزام تیم‌های امدادی اعلام کرد.
